repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes #25365.

These changes fix the weird behavior described in #25365, by applying two simple changes:
- remove all entries of a buffer from the jump list when deleting it
- not adding a new entry to the jump list if the next buffer to be displayed was also found in the jump list

This makes the jump list behave exactly as you would expect when deleting buffers

comment_data.body:
"buf" is the codebase convention
```suggestion
void remove_buffer_from_jumplist(buf_T *deleted_buf)
```

is feed() intentional or can command be used? feed() is asynchronous and hides errors.

```suggestion
    command('clearjumps')
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -182,6 +182,109 @@ describe("jumpoptions=stack behaves like 'tagstack'", function()
   end)
 end)
 
+describe('buffer deletion', function()
+  local base_file = 'Xtest-functional-buffer-deletion'
+  local file1 = base_file..'1'
+  local file2 = base_file..'2'
+  local file3 = base_file..'3'
+  local base_content = 'text'
+  local content1 = base_content..'1'
+  local content2 = base_content..'2'
+  local content3 = base_content..'3'
+  local function delete_buf(file)
+    local bufnr = funcs.bufnr(file)
+    command('bw '..bufnr)
+  end
+
+  before_each(function()
+    clear()
+    feed(':clearjumps<cr>')

comment_data.body: could use dedent() with a literal `[[...]]` string.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -182,6 +182,109 @@ describe("jumpoptions=stack behaves like 'tagstack'", function()
   end)
 end)
 
+describe('buffer deletion', function()
+  local base_file = 'Xtest-functional-buffer-deletion'
+  local file1 = base_file..'1'
+  local file2 = base_file..'2'
+  local file3 = base_file..'3'
+  local base_content = 'text'
+  local content1 = base_content..'1'
+  local content2 = base_content..'2'
+  local content3 = base_content..'3'
+  local function delete_buf(file)
+    local bufnr = funcs.bufnr(file)
+    command('bw '..bufnr)
+  end
+
+  before_each(function()
+    clear()
+    command('clearjumps')
+
+    write_file(file1, content1, false, false)
+    write_file(file2, content2, false, false)
+    write_file(file3, content3, false, false)
+
+    command("edit " .. file1)
+    command("edit " .. file2)
+    command("edit " .. file3)
+  end)
+
+  it('deletes jump list entries when the current buffer is deleted', function()
+    command("edit " .. file1)
+
+    eq(   ''
+       .. ' jump line  col file/text\n'
+       .. '   3     1    0 '..content1..'\n'
+       .. '   2     1    0 '..file2..'\n'
+       .. '   1     1    0 '..file3..'\n'
+       .. '>',
+       exec_capture('jumps'))
+
+    command('bw')
+
+    eq(   ''
+       .. ' jump line  col file/text\n'
+       .. '   1     1    0 '..file2..'\n'
+       .. '>  0     1    0 '..content3,
+       exec_capture('jumps'))
+  end)
+
+  it('deletes jump list entries when another buffer is deleted', function()
+    eq(   ''
+       .. ' jump line  col file/text\n'
+       .. '   2     1    0 '..file1..'\n'
+       .. '   1     1    0 '..file2..'\n'
+       .. '>',

comment_data.body:
use full command names in code. bwipout also works with buffer names, is bufnr() needed?

```suggestion
    command('bwipeout '..file)
```

comment_data.body:
@justinmk How would I do that nicely given that I have to format the string inside the `[[...]]`?

I thought it would be nice not to have the file name/content hard coded in the string 30 times to make the code easier to maintain, but if that style of creating the literals is not in line with the rest of the tests I can change it.

comment_data.body:
> I thought it would be nice not to have the file name/content hard coded in the string

definitely. sometimes it's worth using a trick like replacing a token, e.g. `(([[foo {file1} ...]]):gsub('%{file1%}', 'x'))`

don't need to block on this, though.

comment_data.body:
there is also `:help getjumplist()`, would that be useful for checking this instead of a `:jumps` screentest?

(note: the existing tests in this file were added before `getjumplist()` was added).

```suggestion
    eq({ ... }, funcs.getjumplist())
```

comment_data.body:
I'm not sure to be honest. I like the fact that in the current state it is very easy to understand the state of the jump list, and to visually compare when running the same steps manually. On the other hand, this test now depends on the formatting that `jumps` uses, so if that is ever changed these tests would break too.

I would propose: we keep it like this for now and if it's a good idea I create a follow up PR where I migrate all the tests to use `getjumplist` instead, not just my own.

comment_regular_data.body:
Thanks! Looks worth trying, but needs a test. Also see questions below.

Test could go in [test/functional/editor/jump_spec.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/test/functional/editor/jump_spec.lua). You can [run the test](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/test/README.md#running-tests) like this:

    TEST_FILE=test/functional/editor/jump_spec.lua make functionaltest

## Questions

- would it make sense for the logic to be part of `cleanup_jumplist` ? or why not?
- is this related to https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/9805 , or why not?
    - note that was partially reverted in [21874](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/21874), need to make sure we don't regress again

I have some time the following days so I will try to add some tests.

To answer your questions:
- I don't think it makes sense, because of the way that `cleanup_jumplist` is used throughout the code base. The cleanup I'm doing here is exclusively applicable when deleting a buffer. However, I would like to continue cleaning up the jump list even after this PR is merged, and ideally, the `cleanup_jumplist` function can be removed completely, by making sure the jump list is never put into a "dirty" state to begin with. I think that doing so will make jump lists more stable, but more importantly, make the jump list logic much easier to maintain, as I noticed these `cleanup_jumplist` calls make it very hard to follow what state the jump list is in
- I don't really see #9805 as being related in any way other than it is also concerning the jump list. Given what I said above I would hope that both it and #21874 can be solved in a more fundamental way
@justinmk Would be great if you could take another look at this

> I would like to continue cleaning up the jump list even after this PR is merged, and ideally, the `cleanup_jumplist` function can be removed completely, by making sure the jump list is never put into a "dirty" state to begin with. ... make the jump list logic much easier to maintain, as I noticed these `cleanup_jumplist` calls make it very hard to follow what state the jump list is in. ... and [revert: "shada/context: fully remove jumplist duplicates #10898" #21874](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/21874) can be solved in a more fundamental way

💯  Very much looking forward to that.

> I really don't want to be pushy and I know you're a busy guy but it would be really great if you could help me out here and tell me what else I need to do before merging

- Pinging is helpful, so thanks the for the ping :)
- It is extremely helpful to keep the PR fresh (rebased on latest master). Even though it might sit for awhile, it saves time for everyone if the PR is ready to go when a reviewer gets to it. It also means the latest CI runs against it.
- It looks like CI is failing, did you check those?
    - If it goes away after rebasing, it's possible that it was fixed on master. But this failure looks related to this PR since it involves `xfmark_T`.
    ```
    RUN      T5130 float window with only one tabpage, deleting the last non-floating window's buffer closes other windows with that buffer when there are other buffers if called from non-floating window: 110.00 ms OK
    ==================== File /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/log/asan.28132 ====================
    = /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/buffer.c:1417:30: runtime error: index -1 out of bounds for type 'xfmark_T[100]' (aka 'struct xfilemark[100]')
    =     #0 0x55ab8a61becc in do_buffer /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/buffer.c:1417:58
    =     #1 0x55ab8a385337 in nvim_buf_delete /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/api/buffer.c:1113:16
    =     #2 0x55ab8a45cda5 in handle_nvim_buf_delete /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto/api/private/dispatch_wrappers.generated.h:2668:3
    =     #3 0x55ab8b1d7aea in request_event /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/msgpack_rpc/channel.c:441:19
    =     #4 0x55ab8b84e05d in state_handle_k_event /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/state.c:114:7
    =     #5 0x55ab8b265a90 in nv_event /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:6626:3
    =     #6 0x55ab8b229251 in normal_execute /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:1224:3
    =     #7 0x55ab8b84ddd9 in state_enter /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/state.c:96:26
    =     #8 0x55ab8b20b6d4 in normal_enter /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:513:3
    =     #9 0x55ab8a2ebb9b in main /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/main.c:634:3
    =     #10 0x7f22d9029d8f in __libc_start_call_main csu/../sysdeps/nptl/libc_start_call_main.h:58:16
    =     #11 0x7f22d9029e3f in __libc_start_main csu/../csu/libc-start.c:392:3
    =     #12 0x55ab8a20ef34 in _start (/home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/bin/nvim+0xbcdf34) (BuildId: 11f2a7e818f3896d5facd604dc4e68e21dd2ebd1)
    = 
    = SUMMARY: UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer: undefined-behavior /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/buffer.c:1417:30 in 
    ===================================================================================================
    nan ms test/helpers.lua:334: Found runtime errors in logfile(s): /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/build/log/asan.28132

    stack traceback:
        test/helpers.lua:334: in function 'check_logs'
        test/functional/helpers.lua:959: in function <test/functional/helpers.lua:958>
    ```

> It looks like CI is failing, did you check those?

I did, but to be honest I am having trouble testing this project effectively. The tests fail for me locally and I'm struggling to understand the output of the tests/CI.

Take the output of `ubuntu-22.04 asan clang oldtest` for example:
```
Executed:  1313 Tests
 Skipped:   179 Tests
  Failed:     0 Tests

Failures: 
	Test test_quickfix failed, see output above and summary for more details
```
> Failed 0

but it still fails. And `ubuntu-22.04 asan clang functionaltest` logs
```
ERR 2023-12-10T12:50:29.388 T1346.12868.0 libuv_process_spawn:90: uv_spawn(/usr/bin/pwd) failed: permission denied
```
But I guess this test failing is just a consequence of the `oldtest` failing?

I will look into fixing the failing test(s) today :+1:

@justinmk Alright, I have fixed the issue and I squashed my commits to make the commit message linter happy.

From my point of view this is now ready to merge
@justinmk I rebased on master again, please see if this can be merged

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(jumplist): update jump list when deleting buffers
